pros: Time off, people, half a day on Friday work week
cons: Pay, unable to work from home

pros:

pros: I really enjoyed my time with the other faculty members.
cons: There was no growth in the position.

review_title: Good luck meeting your supervisor…I never did
pros: Precious few. Maybe the cafeteria / break room. It was always nicely stocked.
cons: You will have a hard time figuring out the chain of command. Good luck meeting your dean—they practically hide.

pros: Friendly atmosphere at this job
cons: Most instructors are part time

review_title: Deadend job with no where to go
pros: Nice people to work with.
cons: The pay is low and not much diversity in leadership. Too many deadend career paths.

pros:
Family Environment

cons: Amount of work for pay

pros: Close to home, great team
cons: Long hours, too many blackout dates

pros: Interesting people to work with.
cons: Very very very very low pay , very poor leadership, employees aren't valued and they know it, technology is extremely old and depreciated, there is no innovation from leadership or really anyone, just much ado about nothing...  Everyone seems over worked and under appreciated. Students report feeling undervalued and feeling as if they're just adrift without a support system.

pros: We really serve a purpose in the community - working closely with business & industry to ensure our graduates have the skills necessary to be gainfully employed (improving their own lives - along with their families), while also becoming a skilled and valuable employee, adding to the success of their employer.
cons: Spread across 7 counties and 5 campuses, with 2 additional instructional sites, it is a challenge to know everyone or ensure adequate resources are available at all locations.

review_title: Not Bad, for a Practically For-Profit School
pros: They tell you they appreciate your efforts quite often.
cons: The amount of extra "not really" work taken on by instructors is damaging, and there is no accountability for students -- for example, like the public school system, if they complain to someone at a high enough level of administration, their grade will be changed. Lower-level management turnover is crazy, and every lower-level employee ends up coddling a new set of new-low-level-management-trying-to-make-an-impression whims every two years.

pros: The best things about working for WGTC are that I know what I am doing is assisting someone in achieving their career goals. The benefits are great, especially the retirement benefits. Guaranteed 11 holidays each year and I gain 10 hours of sick leave and 10 hours of annual leave each month.
cons: The pay is not the best. It is also hard to advance because the people that work here get into a job they love and stay until they retire.

pros: To teach, coast, assist individuals to gain knowledge and lead them into their chosen field.  Most students (traditional or non-traditional) have a strong desire to learn and reach their goals.
cons: A few students wanted to do nothing yet move on into the chosen field.  It takes desire and initiative to get to your goals,

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Douglasville, GA
pros: Nobody bothering you very much
cons: No support for management. Department chair was on another campus and never came to our campus one time in four years. Also never supported any events we put on

review_title: Great opportunity to make a difference in people's lives.
pros: The environment provides a safe learning setting to impact people's lives. People who work there are very caring and try to help whenever they can.
cons: Teaching is very demanding, and the responsibilities of teaching weigh heavily, along with the sharp learning curve of the all the requirements from the school and program.

review_title: It's fine. Management has no clue how to effectively run the school.
pros: The work is not physically demanding.
cons: Have to deal with stupid people with decision making power.

pros: Wonderful place to work.
cons: Pay scale for part-time teachers is not as high as some surrounding colleges.

pros: I learned so much from my supervisor. She was very kind and helpful.
cons: It was only a temporary assignment.
